result.execSummary:
The defendant MATTHEW A KLEIN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

No entry into any Class B licensed establishments. Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, only prescription medication with a valid prescription. 
AODA and follow through.
Maintain full-time employment or 5 job search contacts per week.
No contact with known drug users or dealers except in treatment settings.
Give DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
5 months imposed w/credit for time served (150 days credit).  
4 months imposed & stayed for agent's use.  
Balance of jail credit (23 days) applied only if revoked.

8:31 AM Defendant MATTHEW A KLEIN in court, in custody.  Attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Matthew Kolell in court for MATTHEW A KLEIN. Plea questionnaire received and reviewed.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to counts 1 & 2.  Court advises party of their rights, gives citizenship/deportation admonition, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty of counts 1 & 2.  Count 3 is dismissed, but read-in.  Court advises defendant of the citizenship, voting, and/or firearms restrictions when convicted of a felony. Remarks by Atty. Parker and Atty. Kolell.  Court makes its findings and pronounces sentence.  Appeal rights given.  

SENTENCE:  withheld sentence with 2 years probation on both counts.
Count 1 - $200.00 fine + costs = $719 + $250.00 DNA SC.
Count 2 - $300.00 fine + costs =  $939.50

PROBATION CONDITIONS:
Count 1 - 9 months conditional jail time.  5 months imposed w/credit for time served (150 days credit).  4 months imposed & stayed for agent's use.  Balance of jail credit (23 days) applied only if revoked.
No entry into any Class B licensed establishments. Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, only prescription medication with a valid prescription. 
AODA and follow through.
Maintain full-time employment or 5 job search contacts per week.
No contact with known drug users or dealers except in treatment settings.
Give DNA sample.
